registerListener

public void registerListener(AnubisListener listener)
Description copied from interface: AnubisLocator
register a listener - this is a non-blocking method. It does not return a value, instead a notification will be provided to indicate the presence or absence of a provider. There is no guarantee that the registration call will return before the notification is given as the notification is asynchronous. If the partition is stable the notification will arrive with the usual timing guarantees, if not there are no guarantees.

Specified by:
registerListener in interface AnubisLocator

Description copied from interface: AnubisLocator
deregister a listener - non-blocking.

Specified by:

registerStability

public void registerStability(AnubisStability stability)
registerStability registers an interface for stability notifications. This interface is called to inform the user when the local partition becomes stable or unstable.

Specified by:

partitionNotification

public void partitionNotification(View view,
                                  int leader)
This is a temporary fix for a deadlock bug. The implementation of links maintenance (calls to send(), clearConnections() and dropBrokenConnections()) is brain dead in that it can cause a deadlock because upcoming notifications from the partitionManager may deadlock with downward send() invocations from the registers. Making partitionNotification() asynchronous by queueing the requests will avoid the deadlock. Later the implementation of request servicing and link maintenance should be examined.

Specified by:
partitionNotification in interface PartitionNotification
Parameters:
view -
leader -

partitionNotificationImpl

public void partitionNotificationImpl(View view,
                                      int leader)
PartitionNotification interface

                               int sender,

PartitionNotification interface. delivery of a message from the partition transport

Specified by:
objectNotification in interface PartitionNotification

sendToGlobal

public void sendToGlobal(RegisterMsg msg)
Handle deliver of messages to the global register. If the partition is not stable the message will be dropped. Access to the global register is suspended during periods of instability because it may move. This constraint will be relaxed in a later version. If the leader is this node then this nodes global register is the active one, so bypass the comms and deliver directly to the global register.

Parameters:
msg -

sendToLocal

public void sendToLocal(RegisterMsg msg,
                        java.lang.Integer node)
Handle delivery of messages to local registers. Messages are delivered to peer local registers at any time, regardless of partition stability. If the target node is this one then bypass the communications and deliver directly to the local register.

Parameters:
msg -
node -

getTimeQueue

public ActiveTimeQueue getTimeQueue()
Description copied from interface: AnubisLocator
Providers access to a timer queue - this is a utility for users that are building on the AnubisLocator interface that will order their timers with those used by Anubis as well as provide a general timer facility.

Specified by:
getTimeQueue in interface AnubisLocator
